verse: The heads of the ·Levite families [fathers of the Levites] went to talk to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua son of Nun, and to the heads of the ·families [fathers] of all the tribes of Israel.
At Shiloh in the land of Canaan, they said to them, “The Lord commanded Moses that you give us towns where we may live and pastures for our animals.”
So the Israelites obeyed this command of the Lord and gave the Levite people these towns and pastures ·for their own land [from their own inheritance/possessions]:

The Kohath ·family groups [clans] were part of the tribe of Levi [the three sons of Levi were Kohath, Gershom, and Merari; Ex. 6:16; Num. 3:17]. Some of the Levites in the Kohath ·family groups [clans] were from the family of Aaron the priest. To these Levites were ·given [allotted; given by lot] thirteen towns in the areas of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.
The ·other family groups [rest of the sons/descendants] of Kohath were given ten towns in the areas of Ephraim, Dan, and ·West [the half-tribe of] Manasseh.

The ·people from the Gershon family groups [sons/descendants of Gershom] were given thirteen towns ·in the land [from the clans of the tribe] of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and the East Manasseh in Bashan.
The ·family groups [clans of the sons/descendants] of Merari were given twelve towns in the areas of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
So the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] gave the Levites these towns and the pastures around them, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
These are the names of the towns that came from the ·lands [tribe of the sons/descendants] of Judah and Simeon.
The first ·choice of towns [lot] was given to the Kohath ·family groups [clans] of the Levites.
They gave them Kiriath Arba, also called Hebron, and all its pastures in the ·mountains [hill country] of Judah. (Arba was the father of Anak.)
But the fields and the villages around Kiriath Arba had been given to Caleb son of Jephunneh [as his possession].
So they gave the city of Hebron to the descendants of Aaron (Hebron was a city of ·safety [refuge for the killer/manslayer]). They also gave them the towns of Libnah,
Jattir, Eshtemoa,
Holon, Debir,
Ain, Juttah, and Beth Shemesh, and all the pastures around them. Nine towns were given from these two tribes.
·They also gave the people of Aaron these cities that belonged to [And from] the tribe of Benjamin: Gibeon, Geba,
Anathoth, and Almon. They gave them these four towns and the pastures around them.
So these thirteen towns with their pastures were given to the priests, who were from the ·family [sons; descendants] of Aaron.
The other Kohathite ·family groups [clans] of the Levites were ·given [allotted] these towns from the tribe of Ephraim:
Shechem in the mountains of Ephraim (which was a city of ·safety [refuge for the killer/manslayer]), Gezer,
Kibzaim, and Beth Horon. There were four towns and their pastures.
The tribe of Dan gave them Eltekeh, Gibbethon,
Aijalon, and Gath Rimmon. There were four towns and their pastures.
·West [The half-tribe of] Manasseh gave them Taanach and Gath Rimmon and the pastures around these two towns.
So these ten towns and the pastures around them were given to the rest of the Kohathite ·family groups [clans].

The Gershonite ·family groups [clans] of the Levite tribe were given these towns: ·East [The half-tribe of] Manasseh gave them Golan in Bashan, which was a city of ·safety [refuge for the killer/manslayer], and Be Eshtarah, and the pastures around these two towns.
The tribe of Issachar gave them Kishion, Daberath,
Jarmuth, and En Gannim, and the pastures around these four towns.
The tribe of Asher gave them Mishal, Abdon,
Helkath, and Rehob, and the pastures around these four towns.
The tribe of Naphtali gave them Kedesh in Galilee (a city of ·safety [refuge for the killer/manslayer]), Hammoth Dor, and Kartan, and the pastures around these three towns.
So the Gershonite ·family groups [clans] received thirteen towns and the pastures around them.
The Merarite ·family groups [clans] (the rest of the Levites) were given these towns: The tribe of Zebulun gave them Jokneam, Kartah,
Dimnah, and Nahalal, and the pastures around these four towns.
The tribe of Reuben gave them Bezer, Jahaz,
Kedemoth, and Mephaath, along with the pastures around these four towns.
The tribe of Gad gave them Ramoth in Gilead (a city of ·safety [refuge for the killer/manslayer]), Mahanaim,
Heshbon, and Jazer, and the pastures around these four towns.
So the total number of towns given to the Merarite ·family groups [clans] was twelve.
A total of forty-eight towns with their pastures in the ·land [midst of the possession of the sons/children of Israel] of Israel were given to the Levites.
Each town had pastures around it [this was true of all the cities].
So the Lord gave ·the people [Israel] all the land he had promised their ancestors. The people took the land and lived there.

The Lord gave them ·peace [rest] on all sides, as he had ·promised [sworn to] their ancestors. None of their enemies ·defeated [could resist] them; the Lord handed all their enemies ·over to them [into their hands].
He kept every promise he had made to the Israelites; each one came true.
